articles.headline: Comcast Is Said to End $45 Billion Bid for Time Warner Cable
articles.snippet: The merger would have united the country’s two largest cable operators and reshaped the country’s video and broadband markets.
articles.abstract: The merger would have united the country’s two largest cable operators and reshaped the country’s video and broadband markets.
articles.lead_paragraph: Facing intense regulatory scrutiny, Comcast is planning to abandon its $45 billion takeover of Time Warner Cable, people briefed on the matter said on Thursday, ending a bid that would have united the country’s two largest cable operators and reshaped the rapidly evolving video and broadband markets.
articles.byline: By Emily Steel, David Gelles, Rebecca R. Ruiz and Eric Lipton

articles.headline: Justice Department Sues Quicken Loans Over Mortgages
articles.snippet: The government contends that Quicken, one of the nation’s largest mortgage lenders, underwrote hundreds of improper loans through a federal program.
articles.abstract: The government contends that Quicken, one of the nation’s largest mortgage lenders, underwrote hundreds of improper loans through a federal program.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Justice Department filed a lawsuit Thursday against Quicken Loans, the nation’s third-largest mortgage lender, contending that it made hundreds of improper loans through the Federal Housing Administration lending program, costing the agency millions of dollars.

articles.headline: Get Paid to Borrow Money (Risks and Limits Apply)
articles.snippet: Making money by taking out a loan sounds tempting and is theoretically possible, but it’s probably best to stay out of the fray in Europe.
articles.abstract: Making money by taking out a loan sounds tempting and is theoretically possible, but it’s probably best to stay out of the fray in Europe.
articles.lead_paragraph: In the topsy-turvy world of negative interest rates in Europe that has now become a reality, a benchmark for an array of loans fell below zero for the first time this week. The three-month Euribor rate, set by a panel of European banks, hit negative 0.001 percent on Tuesday.

articles.headline: Once Comcast’s Deal Shifted to a Focus on Broadband, Its Ambitions Were Sunk
articles.snippet: The air of inevitability that once hung over the deal dissipated for months as the debate over net neutrality played out in Washington.
articles.abstract: The air of inevitability that once hung over the deal dissipated for months as the debate over net neutrality played out in Washington.
articles.lead_paragraph: When it was announced a little more than a year ago, it felt to many like a sure thing.

articles.headline: With Amazon Atop the Cloud, Big Tech Rivals Are Giving Chase
articles.snippet: Amazon said in its first-quarter earnings report that its cloud division, Amazon Web Services, had revenue of $1.57 billion and operating income of $265 million.
articles.abstract: Amazon said in its first-quarter earnings report that its cloud division, Amazon Web Services, had revenue of $1.57 billion and operating income of $265 million.
articles.lead_paragraph: Amazon unveiled the financial performance of its powerful growth engine for the first time on Thursday, and the numbers sure looked pretty — especially compared with big companies like Microsoft and Google that are chasing it.
articles.byline: By David Streitfeld and Nick Wingfield

articles.headline: First Evidence of a Blunder in Drone Strike: 2 Extra Bodies
articles.snippet: When six bodies instead of four were taken from the wreckage in Pakistan and hastily buried, it was a clear signal that the C.I.A. had made a deadly mistake.
articles.abstract: When six bodies instead of four were taken from the wreckage in Pakistan and hastily buried, it was a clear signal that the C.I.A. had made a deadly mistake.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The first sign that something had gone terribly wrong was when officers from the C.I.A. saw that six bodies had been pulled from the rubble instead of four.
articles.byline: By Mark Mazzetti and Eric Schmitt

articles.headline: Drone Strikes Reveal Uncomfortable Truth: U.S. Is Often Unsure About Who Will Die
articles.snippet: By most accounts, hundreds of militants have been killed by drones. But the results of some strikes have turned out to be deeply troubling.
articles.abstract: By most accounts, hundreds of militants have been killed by drones. But the results of some strikes have turned out to be deeply troubling.
articles.lead_paragraph: Barack Obama inherited two ugly, intractable wars in Iraq and Afghanistan when he became president and set to work to end them. But a third, more covert war he made his own, escalating drone strikes in Pakistan and expanding them to Yemen and Somalia.

articles.headline: The Private Equity Firm That Grew Too Fast
articles.snippet: Flush with cash, Providence Equity Partners made a series of risky, and disastrous, bets during the private equity boom. Now its chief executive is aiming for redemption.
articles.abstract: Flush with cash, Providence Equity Partners made a series of risky, and disastrous, bets during the private equity boom. Now its chief executive is aiming for redemption.
articles.lead_paragraph: Jonathan M. Nelson, the billionaire media mogul and founder of Providence Equity Partners, enters the room — limping.

articles.headline: Jeb Bush Is Definitely, Grumpily Running ... Away From Calories
articles.snippet: Mr. Bush, who has long struggled to lose weight, has adopted a drastic program that is melting away pounds at a staggering rate.
articles.abstract: Mr. Bush, who has long struggled to lose weight, has adopted a drastic program that is melting away pounds at a staggering rate.
articles.lead_paragraph: Steak Tips Susanne, the $21 entree at the Hilton Garden Inn in Manchester, N.H., arrived as a carefully composed plate: strips of sirloin, sautéed peppers and caramelized onions atop a bed of linguine with a side of garlic bread.

articles.headline: Under Regulators’ Scrutiny, Comcast and Time Warner Cable End Deal
articles.snippet: The Justice Department confirmed that it had significant concerns that the merger “would make Comcast an unavoidable gatekeeper for Internet-based services that rely on a broadband connection to reach consumers.”
articles.abstract: The Justice Department confirmed that it had significant concerns that the merger “would make Comcast an unavoidable gatekeeper for Internet-based services that rely on a broadband connection to reach consumers.”
articles.lead_paragraph: When Comcast announced its $45 billion takeover of Time Warner Cable in February 2014, the notion that television viewers would have the freedom to pay for exactly what they wanted to watch and how they wanted to watch it seemed like something that might be possible in the distant future.

articles.headline: Websites in India Put a Bit of Choice Into Arranged Marriages
articles.snippet: While Indian parents still take the lead in arranging marriages, many are turning to websites to widen the pool, and are allowing their children veto power.
articles.abstract: While Indian parents still take the lead in arranging marriages, many are turning to websites to widen the pool, and are allowing their children veto power.
articles.lead_paragraph: NEW DELHI — For thousands of years, fathers in India have arranged the marriages of their children, and Garima Pant — like an estimated 95 percent of her millennial peers — was intent on following this most Indian of traditions.

articles.headline: Drone Strikes on Al Qaeda Are Said to Take Toll on Leadership in Pakistan
articles.snippet: Strikes like the one that killed two Western hostages have forced militant leaders to regroup and seek shelter, analysts say.
articles.abstract: Strikes like the one that killed two Western hostages have forced militant leaders to regroup and seek shelter, analysts say.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON — Revelations of new high-level losses among Al Qaeda’s top leadership in Pakistan’s tribal belt have underscored how years of American drone strikes have diminished and dispersed the militant group’s upper ranks and forced them to cede prominence and influence to more aggressive offshoots in Yemen and Somalia.

articles.headline: Navigating the Thickets of Student Loan Counseling
articles.snippet: Studies show that the required counseling given to incoming college students often is dense, confusing and completed at the busiest time of the year.
articles.abstract: Studies show that the required counseling given to incoming college students often is dense, confusing and completed at the busiest time of the year.
articles.lead_paragraph: As a former student loan borrower himself, President Obama has more than a passing familiarity with the complexities of higher education finance. But in a little-noticed bit of comment last year in an interview with David Karp, the founder of Tumblr, he issued some pointed criticism of the advice that students get on the way into college.
